message:
SYSTEM: 03.Vocabularios-LD_v5.pdf: Página 97
Semantic Technologies in the Web of Data.  Red.es.   4th December 2012 
The GoodRelations Ontology 
• GoodRelations is a standardized vocabulary for product, price, store, 
and company data.  
• Based on the Agent-Promise-Object Principle: 
1.
An agent (e.g. a person or an organization)   
2.
An object (e.g. a camcorder, a house, a car,...) or service (e.g. a haircut), 
3.
A promise (offer) to transfer some rights (ownership, temporary usage, a certain license, etc.) 
on the object or to provide the service for a certain compensation (e.g. an amount of money), 
made by the agent and related to the object or service, and 
4.
A location from which this offer is available (e.g. a store, a bus stop, a gas station,...). 
• Correspondeces in GoodRelations are 
• gr:BusinessEntity for the agent 
• gr:Offering for an offer  
• gr:ProductOrService for the object or service 
• gr:Location for a store or location from which the offer is available 
 
99 
•
http://www.heppnetz.de/ontologies/goodrelations/v1.html
speaker: SYSTEM
